item.title: [GROOVY-10456] Inconsistent exception upon accessing empty property
item.description:

o = new Object()
o[""]

groovy.lang.MissingPropertyException: No such property:  for class: java.lang.Object

comments.comment:
Thanks for spotting that edge case. The StringIndexOutOfBoundsException shouldn't be Groovy behavior in this case.

We could debate whether a different error like IllegalArgumentException might be appropriate but I think sticking with MissingMethodException for compatibility with earlier Groovy versions makes most sense.

It should be fixed in the next releases.
